name: Pillar Press – Content Blocks for Gutenberg
author: Robert DeVore

sections.description:
The Content Blocks plugin from Pillar Press provides you with custom blocks for the new Gutenberg block editor.

Please Note: Content Blocks is under active development and is used on production sites at your own risk.

Because the new editor is still in active production, breaking changes could be expected.

Contribute

Follow along with the block building and contribute to the development.

Content Blocks currently includes the following blocks:

  • Notices Block

Follow along:

  • Website
  • Twitter
  • Github
  • Robert DeVore
  • Devio Digital
sections.installation:
This plugin can be installed directly from your site.

  1. Log in and navigate to Plugins → Add New.
  2. Type “Pillar Press” into the Search box and hit Enter.
  3. Locate the Pillar Press Content Blocks plugin in the list of search results and click Install Now.
  4. Once installed, click the Activate link.

It can also be installed manually.

  1. Download the Content Blocks plugin from WordPress.org.
  2. Unzip the package and move to your plugins directory.
  3. Log into WordPress and navigate to the Plugins screen.
  4. Locate Content Blocks in the list and click the Activate link.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

This plugin can be installed directly from your site.

  1. Log in and navigate to Plugins → Add New.
  2. Type “Pillar Press” into the Search box and hit Enter.
  3. Locate the Pillar Press Content Blocks plugin in the list of search results and click Install Now.
  4. Once installed, click the Activate link.

It can also be installed manually.

  1. Download the Content Blocks plugin from WordPress.org.
  2. Unzip the package and move to your plugins directory.
  3. Log into WordPress and navigate to the Plugins screen.
  4. Locate Content Blocks in the list and click the Activate link.

Can Content Blocks be used with any theme?

Yes, you can use Content Blocks with any theme.

Do I need Gutenberg to use Content Blocks?

Yes, until Gutenberg is merged into core, you will need to install the Gutenberg plugin to use Content Blocks.
